opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer
Class LFGraphDifference

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer.LFGraphDifference

public class LFGraphDifference
extends Object

Represents the difference between two LFGraphs that characterizes their difference as a set of edits: either inserts(), deletes(), or substitutions(). These edits are determined by a specified alignment between the phrases the graphs are supposed to represent. All of the sets of edges returned by this class, and the convenience maps build on top of them, are read-only. Attempting to add or remove elements or keys from any of these (including via any of the iterators) throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

This class also provides the convenience methods insertsFor(LFVertex) and deletesFor(LFVertex), for getting just the inserts or deletes for a specified vertex. The convenience methods substitutionsFor(LFEdge) gets the set of substitutions correspoding to a given edge, and substitutionsBySource() and substitutionsBySourceFor(LFEdge) are similar methods that provide maps whose keys are the source vertices of the substituted edges.

Author:
Scott Martin

Constructor Detail

LFGraphDifference

public LFGraphDifference(LFGraph a,
                         LFGraph b,
                         Alignment alignment)
Creates a new graph difference between a and b, as determined by the specified alignment.

Parameters:
a - The A-position graph.
b - The B-position graph.
alignment - An alignment between a and b where the A-position indices are understood to correspond to a and B-position indices are understood to correspond to b.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If either graph is null, or if the alignment is null.

Gets the graph in the specified position.

Parameters:
position - The position to retrieve a graph for.

reverse

public LFGraphDifference reverse()
Gets an LF graph difference that is the reverse of the present one.

Returns:
An LF graph difference whose A-position graph is the value of this difference's getB(), whose B-position graph is the value of this difference's getA(), and whose alignments are the reverse of this difference's getAlignment().

deletes

public Set<LFEdge> deletes()
Gets the deletes for this graph difference.

Returns:
The set of edges in the A-position graph that have an aligned source vertex and an unaligned target vertex.
See Also:
AlignedEdgeFilter

inserts

public Set<LFEdge> inserts()
Gets the inserts for this graph difference.

Returns:
The set of edges in the B-position graph that have an aligned source vertex and an unaligned target vertex.
See Also:
AlignedEdgeFilter

insertsFor

public Set<LFEdge> insertsFor(LFVertex vertex)
Gets the inserts for a specified vertex.

Parameters:
vertex - The vertex to return the inserts for.
Returns:
The subset of inserts() whose source index is among the targets for the specified vertex, or Collections.EMPTY_SET if none exist.
See Also:
AlignedEdgeFilter

deletesFor

public Set<LFEdge> deletesFor(LFVertex vertex)
Gets the deletes for a specified vertex.

Parameters:
vertex - The vertex to get the deletes for.
Returns:
The subset of deletes() whose source vertex is the specified vertex.
See Also:
VertexMatchFilter

substitutions

public Set<LFEdge> substitutions()
Gets the substitutions for this graph difference.

Returns:
The subset of the B-position graph's edges for which there exists an edge in the A-position graph that meets the following conditions:
  1. The B edge's source is aligned to the A edge's source, but the B edge's target is not.
  2. The B edge's target is aligned to the A edge's target, but the B edge's source is not.
See Also:
CompositeFilter

substitutionsFor

public Set<LFEdge> substitutionsFor(LFEdge edge)
Gets the substitutions for the specified edge.

Parameters:
edge - The edge to get substitutions for.
Returns:
The subset of substitutions() whose source is aligned to the edge's source and whose target is aligned to the edge's target, or Collections.EMPTY_SET if none exist.

substitutionsBySource

public Map<LFVertex,Set<LFEdge>> substitutionsBySource()
Gets a map view of the substitutions in this graph difference.

Returns:
A map whose keys are the source vertices in the set of substitutions() and whose values are the edges whose source vertex is the same as the corresponding key. If there are no substitutions, Collections.EMPTY_MAP is returned.

Note that the returned map is read-only, that is, both its Map.put(Object, Object) method and its entry set's iterator's Iterator.remove() method throw an UnsupportedOperationException. Also, the members of the returned map's entry set are immutable, so that their Map.Entry.setValue(Object) methods also throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

substitutionsBySourceFor

public Map<LFVertex,Set<LFEdge>> substitutionsBySourceFor(LFEdge edge)
Gets a map view of the substitutions for the specified edge.

Parameters:
edge - The edge to get substitutions for.
Returns:
The subset of substitutionsBySource() in which the keys are aligned to the specified edge's source and the associated values' targets are aligned to the specified edge's target. Since this map is based on the one returned by substitutionsBySource(), it is also read-only, and the same stipulations apply to it.
See Also:
substitutionsBySource()
